Around 20,000 bikes are reported stolen in London each year. Thieves think cycle theft is a low-risk, high-reward crime. Follow these tips to lock thieves out and ensure your bike remains safe and secure.

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["\u003cstrong\u003eGet your bike security marked and registered at BikeRegister\u003c/strong\u003e \u003cbr /\u003eHaving your bike security marked and registered is a visible deterrent to bike thieves. They know that if they are caught in possession of a registered bike, the rightful owner can be traced and they will be arrested. \u003ca href=\"https://www.bikeregister.com/\"\u003eFind out how to register your bike\u003c/a\u003e ","\u003cstrong\u003eRecord details of your bike\u003c/strong\u003e \u003cbr /\u003eFrame number (normally found underneath the bike between the pedals or where the back wheel slots in), BikeRegister number, other distinguishing features, and take a photo","\u003cstrong\u003eUse locks of gold 'Sold Secure' standard\u003c/strong\u003e \u003cbr /\u003eAlso, use two different types of lock, with at least one being a high quality D-lock. It takes thieves a few seconds to cut through poor-quality locks. Make it as difficult for them as possible","\u003cstrong\u003eLock the frame and both wheels to the cycle parking stand \u003c/strong\u003e \u003cbr /\u003e \u003ca href=\"/cdn/static/cms/documents/good-locking-practice.pdf\"\u003eSee examples of good locking practice on our poster PDF 2.23MB\u003c/a\u003e \u003cstrong\u003e \u003c/strong\u003e ","\u003cstrong\u003eMake the locks and bike hard to move\u003c/strong\u003e \u003cbr /\u003eLock your bike as close to the stand as possible. \u003ca href=\"/cdn/static/cms/documents/common-bike-theft-techniques.pdf\"\u003eFind out common techniques cycle thieves use\u003c/a\u003e \u003cbr /\u003e \u003ca href=\"/cdn/static/cms/documents/common-bike-theft-techniques.pdf\"\u003ePDF 809KB\u003c/a\u003e ","\u003cstrong\u003eLock your bike at recognised secure cycle parking\u003c/strong\u003e \u003cbr /\u003eIt should be well lit and covered by CCTV.","\u003cstrong\u003eTake the same care to lock your bike securely at home\u003c/strong\u003e \u003cbr /\u003eBikes get stolen from communal hallways, gardens and sheds","\u003cstrong\u003eDon't buy a stolen second-hand bike\u003c/strong\u003e \u003cbr /\u003eInsist on proof of ownership and check the bike frame number at BikeRegister.","\u003cstrong\u003eIf your bike has been stolen, contact the police\u003c/strong\u003e \u003cbr /\u003eGive them your BikeRegister number, photo and any other details"]}

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["For thefts from the railway, Tube, DLR and Tram stations, contact the British Transport Police through their website or call 0800 405 040","For thefts within the City of London, \u003ca href=\"https://www.cityoflondon.police.uk/contact-city-police/reporting-a-crime/Pages/Online-crime-report.aspx\"\u003econtact City of London Police through their website\u003c/a\u003e or call 020 7601 2000","For thefts anywhere else in Greater London, \u003ca href=\"https://www.met.police.uk/report/how-to-report-a-crime/\"\u003econtact Metropolitan Police Service through their website\u003c/a\u003e or call 101"]}
